title: Convert amounts into first equation
text: Let's use "a" as the number of adult tickets and "c" as the number of childrens tickets. The total number of tickets combined is 1,363, therefore we can determine that the first equation is $$a+c=1, 363$$
speech: Let's use "a" as the number of adult tickets and "c" as the number of childrens tickets. The total number of tickets combined is 1,363, therefore we can determine that the first equation is , a plus c, is equal to 1363

title: Convert amoutn into second equation
text: Because the total amount of money made was $12,146. and adult tickets are $12 and childrens $7 we can determine that the second equation is $$12a+7c=12, 146$$.
speech: Because the total amount of money made was $12,146. and adult tickets are $12 and childrens $7 we can determine that the second equation is  12 a plus 7 c is equal to 12146 .

title: Isolate Variable
text: Let's use the first equation to isolate c. With the equation, we can subtract a from both sides to get $$c=1, 363-a$$

title: Plug in
text: We can plug in $$c=1, 363-a$$ using the second equation to get $$12a+7(1,363-a)=12,146$$.
speech: We can plug in  c is equal to 1363 minus, a  using the second equation to get  12 a, plus, 7 times, parentheses 1363 minus a,  is equal to 12146 .

title: Solve for a
text: We can determine that the second equation after plugging in "c" would be 5a+9,541=12,146. We now isolate the variable "a" and get $$5a=2, 605$$. Then, we can divide both sides by $$5$$ to get $$a=521$$.

title: Solve for c
text: After solving for "a", we can plug that value into the first equation to get $$521+c=1, 363$$ which we can determine "c" to be $$842$$.
